articles.title: We must protect refugees and allow them to flourish, say charities
articles.author: The Tablet
articles.excerpt: The World Day of Migrants and Refugees on 24 September is being seen as an to opportunity advocate for the rights of refugees.
articles.summary:
Jesuit Refugee Service and Caritas Westminster will be using the World Day of Migrants and Refugees in England and Wales on Sunday 24 September as an opportunity advocate for the rights of refugees and for policies that protect refugees and allow them to flourish.

Both charities are offering parish resources to mark the day including a text for speaking about the day at Mass, information for parish newsletters, ideas for bidding prayers and suggestions of what can be done as a parish community. A poster and a bookmark with the special prayer for the World Day of Prayer for Migrants and Refugees are also available.

articles.title: Over 4 million Venezuelan migrants struggle for basic needs across the Americas
articles.author: La Croix International staff
articles.excerpt: Venezuelans in the region are facing barriers to receiving medical healthcare and cannot afford three meals a day or access adequate housing, says United Nations
articles.summary:
More than four million 
refugees and migrants from Venezuela
 still have trouble getting access to food, shelter, health care, education, and formal employment in Latin America and the Caribbean, despite attempts by host nations to legalize and integrate them.


According to the most recent Refugee and Migrant Needs Analysis (
RMNA
) for 2023, many Venezuelan migrants and refugees in the region lack reliable sources of income, making it challenging for them to successfully integrate into and contribute to host communities.

articles.title: Over 4 Million Venezuelan refugees and migrants struggle to meet ...
articles.author: UNHCR
articles.excerpt: IOM and UNHCR call for investments in solutions that also benefit host communities.
articles.summary:
GENEVA/PANAMA CITY – Despite efforts by host countries to regularize and integrate refugees and migrants from Venezuela, more than 4 million people still face difficulties accessing food, shelter, health care, education and formal employment in Latin America and the Caribbean.

The latest Refugee and Migrant Needs Analysis (RMNA) for 2023 shows that many Venezuelan refugees and migrants in the region lack stable livelihood opportunities, making it difficult for them to effectively integrate and contribute to host communities.

articles.title: 100 Afghan refugees return home from Iran
articles.author: The Frontier Post
articles.excerpt: KABUL (Khaama Press): The Ministry of Refugees and Repatriation of Afghanistan has confirmed that approximately 100 Afghan migrants have returned from Iran. The Afghan Ministry said on its social …
articles.summary:
KABUL (Khaama Press): The Ministry of Refugees and Repatriation of Afghanistan has confirmed that approximately 100 Afghan migrants have returned from Iran.
 
 The Afghan Ministry said on its social media platform, X, that around 871 Afghan migrants had re-entered the country via the Islam Qala border. Whether these refugees were forcibly deported or returned to the country voluntarily is unclear.
 
 According to the ministry's report, these returnees have been referred to the International Organization for Migration's office for receiving food and non-food assistance.

articles.title: Türkiye debunks disinformation on migrants, refugees
articles.author: Daily Sabah
articles.excerpt: As social media helps them disseminate fake news and disinformation, anti-migrant groups in Türkiye, home to millions of refugees from Syria and migrants...
articles.summary:
As social media helps them disseminate fake news and disinformation, anti-migrant groups in Türkiye, home to millions of refugees from Syria and migrants from around the world, flourish. Combatting disinformation spread by those groups and often picked by far-right media outlets, the Turkish Presidency's Communications Directorate disproved claims smearing migrants and refugees.

In a weekly bulletin against disinformation, the Directorate debunked several reports portraying migrants and refugees as violent criminals.

articles.title: WHO collaborating centre in Italy continues to support refugee and migrant well-being
articles.author: World Health Organization
articles.excerpt: News and Press Release in English on Italy and 1 other country about Health; published on 13 Sep 2023 by WHO
articles.summary: The Italian National Institute for Health, Migration and Poverty (INMP) is now redesignated by WHO as a Collaborating Centre (CC) on Health and Migration Evidence and Capacity Building. To date, INMP has served as a CC for four years. It provides insights and offers context to support the design and implementation of policies that promote the health and well-being of refugees and migrants. The scope of its work surpasses national and European boundaries, sustaining Member States at a global level.

articles.title: Newborn found dead on refugee boat off Italy's island of Lampedusa
articles.author: Web Desk
articles.excerpt: The Italian Coast Guard discovered a dead newborn baby on a refugee boat carrying people to Lampedusa as hundreds of the island's residents demonstrated against a recent spike in arrivals.This…
articles.summary:
A migrant boat carrying refugees to Italy. — AFP
The Italian Coast Guard discovered a dead newborn baby on a refugee boat carrying people to Lampedusa as hundreds of the island's residents demonstrated against a recent spike in arrivals.
This year, about 126,000 migrants and refugees entered Italy, a number that was twice in 2022 around the same time.


More people have arrived in Lampedusa this week alone than the island's permanent population, prompting cries for assistance from local lawmakers, reported
 ANSA
.

articles.title: University of Limerick and Department of Health to collaborate on migrant and refugee health
articles.author: Rebecca Lenihan
articles.excerpt: AN INNOVATIVE new collaboration between University of Limerick (UL) and the Department of Health will involve refugees and migrants directly in the development of public health policy. UL has launched…
articles.summary:
AN INNOVATIVE new collaboration between University of Limerick (UL) and the Department of Health will involve refugees and migrants directly in the development of public health policy.
 
UL has launched a new public health partnership between the World Health Organisation (WHO) Collaborating Centre for Refugee and Migrant Health, based in UL's School of Medicine, and the Department of Health.
 
The Refugee and Migrant Health Partnership is funded by the Department of Health and is designed to involve refugees and migrants directly in the development of public health policy and will also fund bursaries for related teaching programmes and scholarships.

articles.title: UN refugee agency : wave of migrants must be moved off island of Lampedusa
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: The United Nations refugee agency on Friday said it was imperative that the thousands of migrants who have arrived in recent days on the Italian island of Lampedusa be relocated because of its...
articles.summary:
GENEVA (Reuters) - The United Nations refugee agency on Friday said it was imperative that the thousands of migrants who have arrived in recent days on the Italian island of Lampedusa be relocated because of its limited resources. 
Around 7,000 migrants arrived on the shore of the small island in a two-day period, prompting pleas for help from Italy. 
Authorities have organised some transfers to the larger island of Sicily to ease the situation, something the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) expects will continue in the coming days.

articles.title: Libya: Vote to Renew Measures to Combat Migrant Smuggling and Human Trafficking
articles.excerpt: News and Press Release in English on Libya and 1 other country about Protection and Human Rights; published on 29 Sep 2023 by SCR
articles.summary:
Today (29 September), following the closed consultations on the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK), the Security Council is expected to vote on a draft resolution renewing for one year the authorisation for member states, acting nationally or through regional organisations, to inspect and seize vessels on the high seas off the coast of 
Libya
 that they have reasonable grounds to suspect are being used for migrant smuggling or human trafficking from Libya. The Council initially established the authorisation through 
resolution 2240
 of 9 October 2015 and has since renewed it annually, most recently through 
resolution 2652
 of 29 September 2022.

articles.title: Where Do All the Migrants Go?
articles.author:
David North
on
articles.excerpt: People from overseas do not simply settle in the United States, they decide to live in a particular place within America. How are those decisions made and who makes them is the subject of this post.…
articles.summary:
People from overseas do not simply settle in the United States, they decide to live in a particular place 
within
 America. How are those decisions made and who makes them is the subject of this post. We regard migrants as people who come here both temporarily and permanently, legally and illegally.


As I see it, there are three more or less natural forces at work here, and four others that relate to the government. They are:


Natural factors:


Choices made by migrants themselves, who are often related to earlier migrants; they tend to settle near their relatives and countrymen.

articles.title: Refugee-led language school helps migrants
articles.author: Lucrecia Franco
articles.excerpt: 02:57. "Rebuilding trust and reigniting global solidarity," will be on top of the agenda at this year's United Nations General Assembly. One key global issue is the refugee crisis which has seen millions of people flee war-torn and poverty-stricken countries.
articles.summary:
02:57

"Rebuilding trust and reigniting global solidarity," will be on top of the agenda at this year's United Nations General Assembly.

One key global issue is the refugee crisis which has seen millions of people flee war-torn and poverty-stricken countries.

In Brazil, there are over 65,000 registered refugees, a number that grows steadily every year, but one initiative is providing refugees and vulnerable migrants an opportunity to start a new life by using their native languages.

articles.author: Syndicated Content
articles.excerpt: GENEVA (Reuters) - The United Nations refugee agency on Friday said it was imperative that the thousands of migrants who have arrived in recent days o...
articles.summary:
GENEVA (Reuters) – The United Nations refugee agency on Friday said it was imperative that the thousands of migrants who have arrived in recent days on the Italian island of Lampedusa be relocated because of its limited resources.
Around 7,000 migrants arrived on the shore of the small island in a two-day period, prompting pleas for help from Italy.
Authorities have organised some transfers to the larger island of Sicily to ease the situation, something the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) expects will continue in the coming days.

articles.title: Mental Health of Migrants and Refugees
articles.author: Swati
articles.excerpt: Introduction Migration is a phenomenon as old as humanity itself. People have been moving from one place to another in search of better opportunities, safety, …
articles.summary:
Migration is a phenomenon as old as humanity itself. 
People
 have been moving from one place to another in search of better opportunities, safety, and a brighter future. However, this journey isn't always smooth, and the mental health of migrants and refugees often hangs in the balance. In this exploration, we will delve into the intricacies of their experiences, the mental challenges they face, and the various factors contributing to their mental well-being.





A migrant is an individual who moves from one place to another, either within a country or internationally.

articles.title: World Day of Migrants and Refugees 2023: History, Dates, Activities, and FAQs
articles.excerpt: World Day of Migrants and Refugees 2023: World Day of Migrants and Refugees is observed annually on September 26 or the last Sunday of September.
articles.summary:
World Day of Migrants and Refugees 2023: World Day of Migrants and Refugees is observed annually on September 26 or the last Sunday of September. It is a day designated annually by the United Nations to commemorate and honor people who have been compelled to flee their homes, people who have escaped conflict, encountered adversity, and, against all odds, forged their way to find greener pastures in faraway places.

This day has been designated to honor the fortitude and bravery of these individuals and to deepen our comprehension of their plight and the difficult decisions many immigrants have had to make.

articles.title: Churches celebrate World Day of Migrants and Refugees
articles.author: Ellen Teague
articles.excerpt: Westminster cathedral held an international Mass celebrated by the cardinal for the World Day of Migrants and Refugees.
articles.summary:
International Mass in Westminster Cathedral with the Ethnic Communities in London for World Day of Migrants and Refugees



Mazur/cbcew.org.uk








Westminster cathedral held an international Mass last Sunday for the World Day of Migrants and Refugees. Nottingham was among the dioceses displaying on websites resources for the day from the Jesuit Refugee Service UK. These included bidding prayers during Mass and information for parish newsletters.


Cafod offered a special prayer, picking up on the day's message from Pope Francis, 'Free to choose whether to migrate or to stay'.

articles.title: Erdoğan vows concurrent fight against illegal migration, racism
articles.author: Daily Sabah
articles.excerpt: President Erdoğan underlined on Thursday that Türkiye would not be a hub for illegal migrants, but it would also not tolerate racist attacks against...
articles.summary:
As racist messages perpetrated by far-right groups against 
refugees and migrants
 flood social media, President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan reiterated Türkiye's stance on the issue. He stressed that they would not tolerate illegal migration but would also stand against racist behavior and attacks targeting migrants, as well as millions of refugees who fled the war in neighboring Syria.
 
Erdoğan was addressing prospective district governors at an event in the capital Ankara on Thursday as he highlighted his government's stand on the issue.

articles.title: 186,000 migrants, refugees have arrived in southern Europe in 2023, UN says
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.excerpt: According to the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees, 2023 saw an 83% increase of migrants and refugees who arrived in southern Europe compared to last year.
articles.summary:
According to the United Nations, about 186,000 migrants or refugees arrived in Southern Europe in 2023 so far.
The majority of Southern Europe's refugees and migrants departed from Tunisia or Libya, but about 2,500 people who attempted to cross the Mediterranean were found dead or remain missing. 
2022 reported fewer people who died or went missing while trying to reach Southern Europe with a count of 1,680.
The U.N. refugee agency said Thursday that some 186,000 migrants and refugees arrived in Southern Europe so far this year, the vast majority in Italy.

Between January and Sept. 24, over 2,500 people seeking to cross the Mediterranean were found dead or are still missing, a significant increase from the 1,680 people who died or were missing during the same period in 2022, Ruven Menikdiwela, director of the New York office of the U.N. The UNHCR estimates that over 102,000 refugees and migrants from Tunisia and over 45,000 from Libya tried to cross the central Mediterranean to Europe between January and August.

articles.title: German Government Under Pressure As Refugee Numbers Surge
articles.excerpt: Interior minister turns down opposition's calls for a 200,000 ceiling on number of refugees Germany takes annually.
articles.summary:
The German government has come under mounting pressure to tackle migration as the number of irregular migrants entering the country surged in recent months.

Germany's main opposition party, the conservative CDU/CSU alliance, on Sunday renewed its call for a 200,000 ceiling on the number of refugees the country accepts annually.

Christian Social Union's (CSU) chairman and Bavarian premier Markus Soder said the country does not have the capacity to integrate more than 200,000 refugees annually.

"We are for helping refugees, but we are against uncontrolled immigration to Germany," Soder told public broadcaster ARD on Sunday night.

articles.title: Mexico is on the verge of breaking asylum records due to massive arrival of Cubans
articles.author: Carlos Eire
articles.excerpt: From our Bureau of Weaponized Migrations with some assistance from our Bureau of Black Holes That Swallow Migrants A Cuban migrant currently stuck in Mexico said this past week that staying in the…
articles.summary:
From our Bureau of Weaponized Migrations 
with some assistance from our
 Bureau of Black Holes That Swallow Migrants
 
A Cuban migrant currently stuck in Mexico said this past week that staying in the Mexican city of Tapachula was like 'entering a black hole that swallows migrants.' See story below.
 
An unstoppable wave of Cubans keep entering Mexico, hoping to be granted asylum in the U.S. Many of these Cubans get to Mexico by flying to Nicaragua. Others get there by trekking much longer distances from Venezuela or Colombia, crossing the treacherous Darien Gap in Panama.

articles.title: More refugees to come from Latin America, Caribbean under Biden's new 125,000 refugee cap
articles.author: WOKVNews
articles.excerpt: As the number of migrants coming to the U.S.'s southern border is climbing, the Biden administration aims to admit more refugees from Latin America and the Caribbean over the next year
articles.summary:
As the number of migrants coming to the U.S.'s southern border is climbing, the Biden administration aims to admit more refugees from Latin America and the Caribbean over the next year The White House Friday released the targets for how many refugees it aims to admit over the next fiscal year starting October 1 and from what regions of the world.
But in a significant shift, the administration said it aims to admit 35,000 to 50,000 refugees from Latin America and the Caribbean compared to this year's goal of 15,000.

articles.title: West can protect real asylum seekers but need to send home migrant cheats
articles.author: Tim Newark
articles.excerpt: Economic migrants jumping the queue of legal migration, they are not fleeing persecution and should not get refugee status, writes Tim Newark
articles.summary:
Channel chaos...another small boat heading to Dover 
(Image: Getty)
The vast majority of young men crossing the English Channel are not refugees but economic migrants jumping the queue of legal migration – everyone can see that except the lefty activists defending them – and Home Secretary Suella Braverman was right to point out that fact in a speech in Washington DC yesterday. They are not fleeing persecution and should not get refugee status.
With as many as 780 million people eligible to claim asylum under current UN rules, Suella rightly says their Refugee Convention is far too lax in its definition of a refugee, allowing millions of economic migrants to push through our frontiers, denying other legal immigrants their turn and making millions for people-trafficking gangsters.

articles.title: Pakistan's Behaviour Against Afghan Refugees is Unacceptable, Says Taliban
articles.author: Rohit
articles.excerpt: Taliban condemns Pakistan's decision to expel Afghan refugees, citing it as unacceptable. Tensions rise amid a major crackdown on migrants
articles.summary:
A day after Pakistan announced a major crackdown on illegal migrants in the country, the Taliban on Wednesday denounced the decision to expel refugees as unacceptable. Taking to social media platform X, a Taliban spokesperson said as long as the refugees don't leave the country voluntarily, Pakistan should 'tolerate them.'
On Tuesday, Pakistan's interim government said it would expel all refugees, including an estimated 1.7 million from Afghanistan. Islamabad said the crackdown, starting next month, was not aimed at anyone in particular and would apply to all nationalities.

articles.title: Migrants and refugees Mass in Canada celebrates universality, vibrancy of the Church
articles.author: Nicholas Elbers
articles.excerpt: A Mass celebrating the annual World Day for Migrants and Refugees was held Sept. 23 in Richmond, British Columbia, showing the vibrancy of the worldwide Church.
articles.summary:
In his homily, Father Richard Zanotti said it's essential that migrants and refugees don't get blamed for seeking a life of dignity.
 
'The universality of the Church is made visible by all of you gathered for this Eucharist, many cultures around one table to celebrate God's love for us all,' said the Scalabrinian pastor of St. Ann's, where he works with migrant workers in the Fraser Valley.
 
The Church teaches us that we all have a right to a life of dignity, replete with basic human needs like food, shelter, medical attention, and dignified work, he said.

articles.title: Italy's Meloni Invites EU Commission Head To Lampedusa Amid Migration Crisis
articles.excerpt: Prime minister says Rome will take extraordinary measure to tackle immigration, urges EU to launch mission to block seaborne migrants.
articles.summary:
Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said Friday she invited EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen to see first-hand the seriousness of the situation at Lampedusa, the tiny Italian Mediterranean island overwhelmed with migrants.

Meloni said she is hopeful von der Leyen will join her and will accelerate the deployment of the EU resources promised to Tunisia in exchange for blocking migrants' departures from that country.

"President von der Leyen has always been very collaborative. I don't doubt she will be so this time too," Meloni said in a video message circulated by her office.

articles.title: Opposition to propose plan for resolving Syrian refugee crisis
articles.author: Naharnet Newsdesk
articles.excerpt: The Lebanese opposition has prepared a plan for resolving the Syrian refugee crisis that is based on two steps: distributing the refugees on Arab countries and halting the work of UNHCR (U.N. refugee…
articles.summary:
by 
Naharnet Newsdesk
 
05 October 2023, 14:04
 
The Lebanese opposition has prepared a plan for resolving the Syrian refugee crisis that is based on two steps: distributing the refugees on Arab countries and halting the work of UNHCR (U.N. refugee agency) in Lebanon, media reports said.
 
UNHCR is 'not only spending money to consolidate the presence of 850,000 refugees registered on its lists, but also on 900,000 unregistered (Syrian) migrants,' the Nidaa al-Watan newspaper reported on Thursday, quoting opposition sources.

articles.title: World Day of Migrants and Refugees: Caritas Italy calls for more legal pathways
articles.author: Vatican News
articles.excerpt: As the Church celebrates the 109th World Day of Migrants and Refugees, Oliviero Forti, of Caritas Italy, highlights the need to open more humanitarian ...
articles.summary:
By Sr. Nina Benedikta Krapić, VMZ
 
On the World Day of Migrants and Refugees, Oliviero Forti, head of Migration Policies and International Protection at Caritas Italy, spoke to Vatican News about various possibilities and challenges in dealing humanely with the flow of migrants toward Europe.
 
 
As tens of thousands of refugees reach the shores of southern Italy, Caritas Italy is reaching out, not only hosting and accomodating migrants and refugees, but also advocating at European institutions.

articles.title: More than five thousand migrants arrived in Lampedusa within 24 hours.
articles.excerpt: Over the past 24 hours, more than 5 thousand illegal migrants have arrived on the Italian island of Lampedusa; a critical situation has developed at the local refugee reception center. ⠀ According to…
articles.summary:
Over the past 24 hours, more than 5 thousand illegal migrants have arrived on the Italian island of Lampedusa; a critical situation has developed at the local refugee reception center.


⠀


According to officials, on Tuesday, about 110 different vessels arrived on the shores of this island in the Mediterranean Sea, bringing 5,112 people to Italian territory. This is an absolute record. The previous peak in the arrival of migrants to Lampedusa was recorded on August 29, when 2,172 refugees landed on the island in one day.

articles.title: How this man found a creative way to buy a house, with the help of his friends
articles.author: Madeleine Wedesweiler
articles.excerpt: Om Dhungel says it's common for Bhutanese Australians to join together to help each other with work and housing.
articles.summary:
Om Dhungel and a community of Bhutanese refugees in Sydney have teamed up together to help buy houses.
 Source: Supplied
Om Dhungel bought a house in with a loan from Bhutanese friends.
He says it's common for people in the community to loan each other money.
Humanitarian migrants can face many barriers to buying houses in .
Om Dhungel says he'd probably still be struggling to buy a house in now, 25 years after he first arrived, if it wasn't for the help of his friends.
He was born in Bhutan and several years after he moved to in 1998 he was granted asylum as a humanitarian migrant, because of ethnic violence against Nepalese people like him in his hometown.

articles.title: Using word 'Bangladeshi' for every migrant worker is dangerous: Justice S Muralidhar
articles.author: Prashant Jha
articles.excerpt: Former Orissa High Court Chief Justice S Muralidhar on Friday cautioned against labeling every migrant worker as 'Bangladeshi'. He said such sweeping generaliza
articles.summary:
He said such sweeping generalizations often lead to unwarranted national security concerns and unjust treatment of immigrants, refugees and asylum seekers.
"The word Bangladeshi for every migrant is a dangerous word from the point of view of the State. Always, the arguments of national security and integrity is put forth and with even greater vehemence in cases of immigrants, refugees and asylum seekers," 
Justice Muralidhar said.
He reminded that India has always been a country of migrants and immigrants and that borders are political.

articles.title: Migrationstan: The land of migrants
articles.author: Habibul Haque Khondker
articles.excerpt: Imagine a country called Migrationstan -- a land solely inhabited by migrants from around the world. With its 184 million migrant population, it would be the eighth most populous nation on Earth,…
articles.summary:
Imagine a country called Migrationstan -- a land solely inhabited by migrants from around the world. With its 184 million migrant population, it would be the eighth most populous nation on Earth, overshadowing Bangladesh. This highlights the importance of global migration, a topic that has been the focus of the 2023 World Bank's World Development Report.
Within this huge number of migrants, 37 million are refugees, who leave their homes primarily due to political reasons, while the majority of migrants embark on their journeys in pursuit of economic opportunities.

articles.title: Conflicts, Disasters Driving More Migrants to Risk Mediterranean Crossing, Briefers Warn Security Council Ahead of Libya Mandate Decision
articles.excerpt: The Mediterranean remains a perilous route for a swelling number of migrants and asylum seekers trying to reach Europe, Security Council members said today, as they discussed the situation in the high…
articles.summary:
The Mediterranean remains a perilous route for a swelling number of migrants and asylum seekers trying to reach Europe, Security Council members said today, as they discussed the situation in the high seas off Libya ahead of a decision to renew resolution 2240 (2015), which authorizes States and regional groups to inspect and seize vessels in that area suspected of being used for migrant smuggling or human trafficking.
Ruven Menikdiwela, Director of the New York Office of the High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), said that while nearly 50,000 refugees and asylum seekers are registered with the refugee agency in Libya, it is not authorized to access the disembarkation points.

Between January and Sept. 24, over 2,500 people seeking to cross the Mediterranean were found dead or are still missing, a significant increase from the 1,680 people who died or were missing during the same period in 2022, Ruven Menikdiwela, director of the New York office of the U.N. articles.title: Pakistan's Forced Expulsion Endangers Afghan Migrants: Amnesty
articles.author: MENAFN
articles.excerpt: International Amnesty urged Pakistan to support Afghan refugees and not force them out of the country. They are concerned that if these ref
articles.summary:
(MENAFN- Khaama Press) International Amnesty urged Pakistan to support Afghan refugees and not force them out of the country. They are concerned that if these refugees return to Afghanistan, they could be mistreated, prosecuted and harmed by the Taliban.

Nadiya Rahman, a spokesperson for International Amnesty in South Asia, stated that the organization urges the Pakistani government to allow Afghan refugees to live in Pakistan with dignity and without fear of deportation to Afghanistan.

The organization has also called on the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees to expedite the registration and processing of requests from Afghans seeking protection in Pakistan.

articles.title: Biden Admin to Allow More Refugees From Latin America
articles.author: Charlie McCarthy
articles.excerpt: President Joe Biden's administration plans to raise the number of refugees allowed from Latin America and the Caribbean amid an increasing migrant crisis at the southern border, CNN reported.
articles.summary:
President Joe Biden's administration plans to raise the number of refugees allowed from Latin America and the Caribbean amid an increasing migrant crisis at the southern border, CNN reported.

The State Department has proposed admitting between 35,000 to 50,000 refugees from Latin America/the Caribbean in fiscal year 2024, according to a draft report obtained by CNN. That's up from 15,000 in fiscal year 2023.

The proposed changes would give migrants a legal avenue by which to enter the country without flocking to the U.

articles.title: Swindon's new cabinet asked to affirm commitment to refugees
articles.author: Aled Thomas
articles.excerpt: Members of Swindon Borough Council's Labour cabinet are asked to join a refugee sanctuary network.
articles.summary:
Image caption, 
 is considering joining a refugee sanctuary network
Wiltshire politicians have been asked to affirm their commitment to welcoming refugees and asylum seekers.
's Labour cabinet is considering requests for the borough to join the growing 
City of Sanctuary UK
 network. 
The group works with councils to foster inclusivity, solidarity and compassion.
The status will be largely symbolic as Swindon is already in the top five for cities and towns in the south west taking in refugees.
That is according to a report put to cabinet on Wednesday by the City of Sanctuary team, the 
Local Democracy Reporting Service
 said.

articles.title: Lebanese troops rescue 27 migrants from sinking boat off Lebanon's coast
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.excerpt: The Lebanese army and the country's civil defense recused early Saturday 27 migrants whose boat was sinking off the coast of north Lebanon, the military said in a statement. Over the past years, thousands of Lebanese, Syrians and Palestinian migrants took the dangerous trip from Lebanon across the Mediterranean seeking a better life in Europe. Lebanon has hosted refugees for years.
articles.summary:
BEIRUT (AP) — The Lebanese army and the country's civil defense recused early Saturday 27 migrants whose boat was sinking off the coast of north Lebanon, the military said in a statement.
The army did not say where the migrants were heading nor did it give their nationalities.
Over the past years, thousands of Lebanese, Syrians and Palestinian migrants took the dangerous trip from Lebanon across the Mediterranean seeking a better life in Europe. Such migrations intensified since the country's historic economic meltdown began in October 2019.
